title: cloudbetscam
author: cloudbetscam
content: Hi,I'm opening this topic on the forum to introduce you to Cloudbet scammers. 3 years ago I opened an account on Cloudbet, I made a deposit of about 0.29BTC, I played on the account and reached 0.92BTC. After that I could not log into the account. I wrote to support, and they replied that the account was frozen and that they would contact me via email. After that they stopped responding to my email. Every 2-3 months I send them an email, but no one answers, now I have decided to put an end to the fraudsters. I sent them documents for verification, my ID, selfie with ID, proof of address, but nothing. Can you give me some guidance on where to report this case. I have a lot of evidence and screenshots.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Try to move this thread (command is the lower left of this thread) to Scam accusations board or just make thread there, make sure you follow this scam reporting format[1]About cloudbet, there are lots scam accusations against them actually, i dont know if they are already resolved. But for ypur case i dont know why it takes you too long to make an action against them, a week past should be suspicious for them and make actions by posting in any gambling community forum/ or subreddit, or even take legal actions if necessary.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=260073.0

comments.author: MainIbem
comments.body: You know it's very common labeling casino site scammer but one thing I must asked you is that whenever you are reporting casino or gambling site you should come with facts or evidence to proof they scammed you, if necessary make a screenshot from the email communication how you guys communicated from the beginning till date this could make your allegations authentic.

comments.author: cloudbetscam
comments.body: Quote from: MainIbem on November 01, 2022, 01:21:29 PMYou know it's very common labeling casino site scammer but one thing I must asked you is that whenever you are reporting casino or gambling site you should come with facts or evidence to proof they scammed you, if necessary make a screenshot from the email communication how you guys communicated from the beginning till date this could make your allegations authentic.Can I show proofs here?

comments.body: Quote from: cloudbetscam on November 01, 2022, 01:27:41 PMQuote from: MainIbem on November 01, 2022, 01:21:29 PMYou know it's very common labeling casino site scammer but one thing I must asked you is that whenever you are reporting casino or gambling site you should come with facts or evidence to proof they scammed you, if necessary make a screenshot from the email communication how you guys communicated from the beginning till date this could make your allegations authentic.Can I show proofs here?Move your topic to the scams accusations thread and then you can post with the right format. You can use this as a guide when reporting. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=260073.0

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: Quote from: cloudbetscam on November 01, 2022, 12:57:09 PMHi,I'm opening this topic on the forum to introduce you to Cloudbet scammers. 3 years ago I opened an account on Cloudbet, I made a deposit of about 0.29BTC, I played on the account and reached 0.92BTC. After that I could not log into the account. I wrote to support, and they replied that the account was frozen and that they would contact me via email. After that they stopped responding to my email. Every 2-3 months I send them an email, but no one answers, now I have decided to put an end to the fraudsters. I sent them documents for verification, my ID, selfie with ID, proof of address, but nothing. Can you give me some guidance on where to report this case. I have a lot of evidence and screenshots.Why took you this long to tell the public about your case against Cloudbet, unfortunately, your chances are not good there are already a lot of scam accusations against Cloudbet, there are a few resolves but many are unresolved or ignored, I don't know if your chances but still post your accusations against Cloudbet in the scam section for reference for those who will do research about Cloudbet reputation, it can help others and minimize people that will play on this casino.

comments.author: cloudbetscam
comments.body: Quote from: aioc on November 01, 2022, 01:34:22 PMQuote from: cloudbetscam on November 01, 2022, 12:57:09 PMHi,I'm opening this topic on the forum to introduce you to Cloudbet scammers. 3 years ago I opened an account on Cloudbet, I made a deposit of about 0.29BTC, I played on the account and reached 0.92BTC. After that I could not log into the account. I wrote to support, and they replied that the account was frozen and that they would contact me via email. After that they stopped responding to my email. Every 2-3 months I send them an email, but no one answers, now I have decided to put an end to the fraudsters. I sent them documents for verification, my ID, selfie with ID, proof of address, but nothing. Can you give me some guidance on where to report this case. I have a lot of evidence and screenshots.Why took you this long to tell the public about your case against Cloudbet, unfortunately, your chances are not good there are already a lot of scam accusations against Cloudbet, there are a few resolves but many are unresolved or ignored, I don't know if your chances but still post your accusations against Cloudbet in the scam section for reference for those who will do research about Cloudbet reputation, it can help others and minimize people that will play on this casino.The reason is because they said the account was under review, after that they stopped responding to messages. For now, I have reported the case to Interpol, Curacao egaming and askgamblers. I posted a bad review on all sites. I will also post in channels on Telegram where I have over 10,000 bettors.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: cloudbetscam on November 01, 2022, 01:42:26 PMQuote from: aioc on November 01, 2022, 01:34:22 PMQuote from: cloudbetscam on November 01, 2022, 12:57:09 PMHi,I'm opening this topic on the forum to introduce you to Cloudbet scammers. 3 years ago I opened an account on Cloudbet, I made a deposit of about 0.29BTC, I played on the account and reached 0.92BTC. For now, I have reported the case to Interpol, Curacao egaming and askgamblers. I posted a bad review on all sites. I will also post in channels on Telegram where I have over 10,000 bettors.Good that you did that, all those complainants of Cloudbet should also do that, so they can stop Cloudbet from scamming more people, and start resolving these issues if they want to continue to operate, its not good that those who got scammed just bear it in silent, if they think that they have a case and they believe that their accounts are clean then they should create a protest and file complainst on independent gambling review platforms, if they do not do this expect Cloudbet to scam more gamblers.

comments.author: Mr. Magkaisa
comments.body: Quote from: cloudbetscam on November 01, 2022, 12:57:09 PMHi,I'm opening this topic on the forum to introduce you to Cloudbet scammers. 3 years ago I opened an account on Cloudbet, I made a deposit of about 0.29BTC, I played on the account and reached 0.92BTC. After that I could not log into the account. I wrote to support, and they replied that the account was frozen and that they would contact me via email. After that they stopped responding to my email. Every 2-3 months I send them an email, but no one answers, now I have decided to put an end to the fraudsters. I sent them documents for verification, my ID, selfie with ID, proof of address, but nothing. Can you give me some guidance on where to report this case. I have a lot of evidence and screenshots.- If you have strong evidence, just follow what one of our colleagues said here that you appealed the scam accusation and just follow what you should do there. It's also pretty big that you can't get out of couldbet if what you're accusing is true. And that's probably a long process. You just didn't determine if that happened the first few years you created an account over this gambling platform. or 2 years or recently?

comments.author: suzanne5223
comments.body: Quote from: cloudbetscam on November 01, 2022, 01:42:26 PMThe reason is because they said the account was under review, after that they stopped responding to messages. For now, I have reported the case to Interpol, Curacao egaming and askgamblers. I posted a bad review on all sites. I will also post in channels on Telegram where I have over 10,000 bettors.Fair enough since you have reported the issue on Askgamblers and I trust Askgamblers to investigate the issue since they have handled countless malpractices of the crypto casinos.In the meantime, I will advise you to move this thread to the scam and accusation section as you're already advised by some users, and also provide the evidence you have to back up this accusation so the forum member will be sure this is for real.Edit: I check what Askgamblers have to say about the casino in the subject and this is what I see

comments.author: piebeyb
comments.body: include a screenshot proof link will be very much needed when you make this thread, of course it will be very helpful for all of us to give the right advice for you, BTW why did you create an account with the name cloudbetscam , I hope you are not dropping that gambling site, I have seen you also in the Cloudbet thread here https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=333552.msg61220668#msg61220668to be honest, I also have several gambling site accounts and almost stopped a few years when I re-entered my account banned and blocked so I couldn't play the game and I didn't dare to make a deposit before my account came back and contacted their service support to complete, I hope your problem can be solved

comments.author: Cryptomiles1
comments.body: You actually don't need any authorization to post proof of evidence or not, at first you would have posted it to make you statement very corporate otherwise you could be seen as someone who don't have enough words or strong reason for you to call them scammers. You have to be very careful otherwise i don't think they would respond to you since is been 2 to 3 years now.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.created_time: November 01, 2022, 08:41:10 PMLast edit: November 14, 2023, 02:29:34 AM by PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: suzanne5223 on November 01, 2022, 04:17:08 PMEdit: I check what Askgamblers have to say about the casino in the subject and this is what I seeThis is unfortunate, this just really means of cloudbet being so scammy now a days, a kind of bs who doesn't want to solve their doings.Quote from: Cryptomiles1 on November 01, 2022, 08:21:14 PM... otherwise you could be seen as someone who don't have enough words or strong reason for you to call them scammers.For accusing a reputed casino, almost everyone will defend them no matter what the shown evidence is. The complainant will be assumed as a someone who break their terms, or people will twist the issue to complainant's other past issue, etc. (example of stake having past issues). It's like they are paid to defend the platform even though the obvious mistake is the platform.But for someone like cloudbet, who have already bad image, people will not be neutral, people will suggest possible ways to do against them. And that's the reality.Quote from: Cryptomiles1 on November 01, 2022, 08:21:14 PMYou have to be very careful otherwise i don't think they would respond to you since is been 2 to 3 years now.About the timeframe, yes, that's unfortunate, i don't know if this will be still solve, probably not. Well, let's be positive about it though.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: All the while I was thinking Cloudbet has just adopted a more aggressive approach in promoting their old brand. I was even excited to see them having a signature promotion on this forum after quite some time. They had a good one for several months. It had just ended a couple of months ago. It is pointless, however, to explore marketing strategies while staying unresponsive to their own players. Anyway, have you explored all possible ways to reach out to them? You might want to message Cloudbet here. It's not active for several months now but they might notice it through their email. And supply all the evidences that you've got.

comments.author: Obari
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on November 01, 2022, 01:05:52 PMTry to move this thread (command is the lower left of this thread) to Scam accusations board or just make thread there, make sure you follow this scam reporting format[1]About cloudbet, there are lots scam accusations against them actually, i dont know if they are already resolved. But for ypur case i dont know why it takes you too long to make an action against them, a week past should be suspicious for them and make actions by posting in any gambling community forum/ or subreddit, or even take legal actions if necessary.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=260073.0While moving this to the thread, try as much as possible to submit enough evidence against them and follow the directives and instructions on the scam accusation board.This big and reputable casinos are fond of this acts and just as the @cryptomiles1 has said that, most people will support them and it wouldn't be any less difficult for you to win this case as they have both the money and also the necessary powers to win you on this and beside, this claims have been there for long.And since you reported to the necessary authorities including Interpol, you should as well post reports from them too.

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on November 01, 2022, 01:05:52 PMTry to move this thread (command is the lower left of this thread) to Scam accusations board or just make thread there, make sure you follow this scam reporting format[1]He already created another thread with a same content on Scam Accusations section [1] he just want to warn everybody about Cloudbet and want to force Cloudbet to look into his accusations. But the problem is the Cloudbet's representative still not logging into their account, so we can't expect the representative will reply his accusation. The weird thing here is @OP already wait for long time to solve his issue, actually he should go to legal court since the amount is huge.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5419040.0

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: cloudbetscam on November 01, 2022, 12:57:09 PMCan you give me some guidance on where to report this case. I have a lot of evidence and screenshots.You can formally begin by making a thread of your accusation against cloudbet on this forum, simply locate the scam and accusation board (link to this board is already shared here by another user) and formally report your case in details.Good thing is that cloudbet is one of the supposedly trusted casino thats listed on this forum, and i also believe they have a huge userbase on this forum as well, therefore a lot of users will be happy to study the case, take critical look at your evidences, contact cloudbet to hear/read their own part of the issue, and if in the end, it turns out your account was restricted unjustly, then be sure that they are either going to refund your money back to you or they will be blacklisted here.But if in the other way round, it happened that you are the one accusing cloudbet wrongly, then also be ready for some tags.wish you all the best bud.

comments.author: Cointxz
comments.body: Quote from: cloudbetscam on November 01, 2022, 01:27:41 PMQuote from: MainIbem on November 01, 2022, 01:21:29 PMYou know it's very common labeling casino site scammer but one thing I must asked you is that whenever you are reporting casino or gambling site you should come with facts or evidence to proof they scammed you, if necessary make a screenshot from the email communication how you guys communicated from the beginning till date this could make your allegations authentic.Can I show proofs here?Yes. You can upload your proof on imgur.com/upload then the copy the link here so that we can view it in the imgur website since you can’t post image here due to your rank limitation.I’m just concern on the outcome of your complaint here. Cloudbet is not responsive here on answering concern but you can still try. Why does it took you so much time to finally have an update to your issue. They might gave you an excuse that your case is already forgotten since this issue is very old. @icopress might help you to notify the cloudbet team since he is the cloudbet signature campaign manager before which means he has contact on the team to look in your case. Just provide the proof to strengthen your claim.

comments.author: Haunebu
comments.body: Cloudbet's scam accusations have been increasing over time which is why most gamblers in this forum actively avoid it.Why on earth would you send your private documents to an anonymous site like Cloudbet when you were aware of the fact that they were shady op? You just made matters worse for yourself by doing this.
